titleStmt.title: Prophetick admonitions to the city of London : of four great calamities like to befall it, viz. 1. Destruction of their houses, fullfilled in 1666. 2. Slaughters of their persons, wives and children. 3. Loss of their goods and estates, and, 4. Violation and slavery of their consciences. And of the only means to prevent 'em. / First preached and afterwards printed, and dedicated to the citizens, by Thomas Reeves, B. in divinity, in the year 1657.
titleStmt.author: Reeve, John, 1608-1658.

titleStmt.title: Prophetick admonitions to the city of London : of four great calamities like to befall it, viz. 1. Destruction of their houses, fullfilled in 1666. 2. Slaughters of their persons, wives and children. 3. Loss of their goods and estates, and, 4. Violation and slavery of their consciences. And of the only means to prevent 'em. / First preached and afterwards printed, and dedicated to the citizens, by Thomas Reeves, B. in divinity, in the year 1657.
titleStmt.author: Reeve, John, 1608-1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Meekes in Hanging Sword-court in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.
